verses.kjv: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.
verses.ct: I told myself, 'I will watch what I say so I don't sin with my words. I will put a muzzle on my mouth as long as wicked people are around me.'

verses.kjv: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.
verses.ct: I stayed completely silent — I didn't say a word, not even anything good. But my pain only grew worse.

verses.kjv: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,
verses.ct: My heart burned inside me. The more I thought about it, the hotter the fire grew, until I finally spoke:

verses.kjv: LORD, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is: that I may know how frail I am.
verses.ct: "LORD, show me how short my life really is. Let me understand the number of my days so I can grasp how brief my existence is."

verses.kjv: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
verses.ct: "Look — you've made my life just a few inches long, and my entire lifespan is nothing in your sight. Truly, every person at their very best is just a breath. Selah."

verses.kjv: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
verses.ct: "People go through life like shadows. They rush around for nothing. They pile up wealth without knowing who will end up with it."

verses.kjv: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.
verses.ct: "So now, Lord, what am I waiting for? My hope rests entirely in you."

verses.kjv: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.
verses.ct: "Rescue me from all my sins. Don't let fools mock me and use me as an insult."

verses.kjv: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.
verses.ct: "I kept quiet and didn't open my mouth, because you are the one who did this."

verses.kjv: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.
verses.ct: "Take your punishment away from me. I am being destroyed by the force of your hand."

verses.kjv: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
verses.ct: "When you discipline someone for their sin through correction, you dissolve what they treasure like a moth eats cloth. Truly, every person is just a breath. Selah."

verses.kjv: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
verses.ct: "Listen to my prayer, LORD, and pay attention to my cry. Don't ignore my tears. I am just a visitor passing through your world — a temporary resident, just like all my ancestors were."

verses.kjv: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.
verses.ct: "Turn your gaze from me so I can find some joy again, before I depart this life and am gone forever."
